SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am11
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am11.model.players.utils

Class CardContainer

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am11.model.players.utils.CardContainer
public class CardContainer extends Object
The CardContainer class represents a container for a FieldCard in the game.

This class is used to store a FieldCard and keep track of which corners of the card are covered. It provides methods to get the card, get the covered corners, cover a corner, check if a corner is covered, and check if the card's color equals a specified color.

If a corner is covered, the corresponding Boolean value in the EnumMap is true; otherwise, it is false.

The CardContainer class provides a static factory method of for creating a new CardContainer object. This method takes a FieldCard object as a parameter and returns a new CardContainer object with the specified card and all corners uncovered.

The CardContainer class also provides methods to get the card, get the covered corners, cover a corner, check if a corner is covered, and check if the card's color equals a specified color. These methods are used to interact with the card and the covered corners in the container.

    • cover

      public Optional<Item> cover (@NotNull @NotNull Corner corner)
      Covers a specified corner of the card and returns the item on that corner.

      This method takes a Corner object as a parameter, sets the corresponding Corner as covered, and returns the item on the specified corner of the card. If the card is retro, the item on the retro side of the card is returned.

      If there is no item on the specified corner, this method returns an empty Optional.

      Parameters:
      corner - The corner of the card to cover.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the item on the specified corner of the card, or an empty Optional if there is no item on that corner.

    • isColorEquals

      public boolean isColorEquals (@Nullable @Nullable GameColor color)
      Checks if the color of the card in the container equals the specified color.

      This method takes a GameColor object as a parameter and compares it with the color of the card in the container. If the specified color is not null and equals the color of the card, this method returns true; otherwise, it returns false.

      Parameters:
      color - The color to compare with the color of the card.
      Returns:
      true if the specified color is not null and equals the color of the card, false otherwise.

    • isCardEquals

      public boolean isCardEquals (@Nullable @Nullable FieldCard card)
      Checks if the card in the container equals the specified card.

      This method takes a FieldCard object as a parameter and compares it with the card in the container. If the specified card is not null and equals the card in the container, this method returns true; otherwise, it returns false.

      Parameters:
      card - The card to compare with the card in the container.
      Returns:
      true if the specified card is not null and equals the card in the container, false otherwise.

    • isRetro

      public boolean isRetro()
      Checks if the card in the container is retro.

      This method returns the boolean value indicating whether the card in the container is retro.

      Returns:
      true if the card in the container is retro, false otherwise.
